author: nishant0
content: ah

author: nishant0
content: your lighthouse node is only running noise

author: nishant0
content: https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/issues/1631

author: nishant0
content: we can only use secio for now, because of the above ^

author: nishant0
content: I have disabled noise in Prysm nodes for now as its incompatible with lighthouse

author: protolambda
content: yep, just figured out the same with Adrian

author: protolambda
content: Added noise to rumor to test as well: https://github.com/protolambda/rumor/pull/2

author: protolambda
content: But getting an error while connecting to lighthouse

author: protolambda
content: It works with Teku though

author: nishant0
content: yeap, rust-libp2p expects and also reads for an extra length prefix when sending protobuf encoded payload, so the handshake always fails

author: agemanning
content: Has the noise spec changed again? Which is the correct behaviour?

author: nishant0
content: from what I understand rust-libp2p diverges from the spec

author: agemanning
content: The 12.1 spec has removed interop and so we've removed secio. If we diverge from the spec, we will update and support the spec noise for altona

author: agemanning
content: I'll look into this today

author: nishant0
content: ok great, thank you

author: nishant0
content: let me know when its fixed and I can give it a try again

author: agemanning
content: But it means if we want to talk with prysm, prysm must also support noise

author: nishant0
content: yeap I can make noise the default too

author: agemanning
content: Cool I'll ping you once I've looked into it. Won't be able to check for a few hours
